messages.content: Aeolian Burr wakes up in his bed.

Indeed… I arise to my feet and head to my desk.

Here is the location where one may bear witness to the miracle of creation, to the conception that arises from a heavily pregnant mind. …Mm. No, that one’s too far. Marking that as a ‘no’ for any public speeches. An architect’s work is never done, whether the building is of structures or ideas.

The king is dead now. This may affect things. Annoying. I find myself too distracted to get much done right here right now, and exit my quarters.
Theodoric Mulligan is waiting for Aeolian at the entrance. "Good morning, Lord Burr!"
“Yes, I suppose so. Despite everything, the morning is good.” I nod.
"Are you ready for work today, sir?"
“Indeed.” What the fuck was I going to do today again. Uh.
"Would you like to hear the news from last night, sir?"
“…Mhm. Catch me up, my recollection is slightly… incomplete.”
"His majesty Emperor Aragon III was able to pull through, but he’s comatose. They don’t know when he’ll be able to wake up, if ever, but he’s alive!"
“I see. How curious. Where will interim power go, then?”
"I’m unsure, sir!"
“Concerning. There may be a few people who attempt desperate power plays at this point, then.” I ponder.
"Are you worried about someone in particular, sir?"

“The Duchess already acts as though she can do whatever she wants. I would not be surprised if this emboldens her. And Asturias is already the most obvious culprit for the attack. He’s certainly plotting something or other.”
"Would you like the church to step in, then?" He crosses his arms, thinking.

“I have no preference on whatever they may sully their hands with. There is no god but humanity, and perhaps Sagittarius slightly.” I gesture dismissively. “They may be able to instate more order, but this disorder may present an opportunity for us as much as it does our opponents.”
"What’s the plan then, Lord Burr?"
“Reconnaissance and study. It may be prudent to — within a secure environment — converse with these figures of note. And I shall see if some legal quirk may be leveraged to allow domain expansion.”

"Understood, sir! I’ll let them know you want to speak!" Theo.

"That won’t be necessary." Imperial Prince Asturian VII enters slightly, giving a polite knock on the door he is already most of the way through. There’s a royal guard following him.
“Hm. Good morning, Asturian.” I greet this man, who has never been named Asturias, that isn’t his name. “What do I owe the honor of this visit?”

"Please…" He smiles maliciously. "Call me Acting Emperor Asturian."

"Oh- Is it already settled?" Theo.

"Quite so! It is my birthright, after all!" Asturian.
“Actually, it isn’t your birthright, because it was your brother’s. That is why you have not done anything of note for a very long time.” I correct his mistake in wording.
"By a minute stolen from me by a subhuman-" Asturian stops himself. "Agh… Shall we discuss things in your office?"
“Certainly, Mr. Asturian.” I head to my office.

They all follow.

"As you are no doubt aware, there are still no apprehended suspects in the… Horrific attempt on my brother's life." Asturian looks around the room with mild bemusement.
“Yeeees, you’re here now, after all, so I imagine the investigation is rather early and inconclusive. Could I get you something to drink?”

"Well, I have been made aware of a rather obvious suspect that seems to be above the qualifications of my brother’s poor military. A criminal element right here in your territory." Asturian.

"Umm, your majesty… Lord Burr has made many attempts to-" Theo stops once he notices that Asturian isn’t paying attention to him.

“That is true.” In absence of an answer from him, I simply make coffee for myself. 
“It is, however, significantly out of their normal scope of operations. Such a haphazard group of ruffians wouldn’t have anything to gain directly from a move like this. If, say, The Faceless are responsible for this, it isn’t because they had intrinsic motive to end the man’s life. I would presume it would be because this was a job given to killers for hire.”
"Yes, well, regardless…" He waves his hand dismissively. "These criminals operate in your territory and as your emperor I demand that you stamp them out and avenge your… Fallen emperor."

I sip coffee extremely loudly. “Mm. Stop crime… I truly hadn’t thought of that, Asturian. Perhaps an accident should befall me as well.” I smile. “I will, of course, continue my pursuit of disorder that plagues my territory.”

"I’m not asking for something so short term. I want you to hand me my brother’s killer or else I will reach the natural conclusion that this barony of yours is unsuited for my empire." Asturian grins.

“How unfortunate. I also fear your empire may be unsuited for my barony.” I drink coffee.
“I will begin an investigation post-haste, but I hope we can part amicably from this conversation as peers. Your title outranks mine, but mine is real, so aren’t we about even when you do the math?” I shrug.
"I don’t appreciate your digs at me. My power is very much real and I could have you executed for your insolence."
“True. It would be an interesting moment of precedent for this administration.” He obviously will not do that, but I tone down my level of escalation slightly.

"But you are thankfully still useful to me so long as you bring me the head of the faceless on a platter!” Asturian.

"My head? That’s not very nice." Frank Linjamin is here now. It doesn’t feel like he’s just appeared, it’s like he’s only just allowed himself to be noticed. "Hasn’t anyone ever taught you not to speak ill of me?"

Theo rushes to Aeolian's side and unsheathes his sword.
“How fascinating. Well, here he is. You’re welcome.” I chuckle. I don’t actually understand what is going on, and this is probably bad, but I need to remain collected for negotiation purposes.

"Guard, kill that man!" Asturian trembles.

"Not a very smart move!" Frank takes out his signature knife.

((Roll initiative))

Frank skips his turn.

Theo attempts to hit Frank with his sword. It misses.

Asturian throws a knife at him, which also missed and just gets stuck in Aeolian's wall.

The guard finally lands a successful hit on Frank, dealing 5 damage.

It’s @Aeolian Burr's turn!
Yes, I suppose so. I retrieve my material component, a bit of welder's glass, and cast Sanctuary on Theodoris. I then grab my quarterstaff from against the wall. This is my turn.

Frank Linjamin stabs the guard 3 times until he collapses on the floor.

Theo hops up on the desk and tries to aim his sword at Frank’s mask. This misses.

Asturian just tosses a few random objects he can grab onto at Frank, who effortlessly dodges them.

It’s Aeolian’s turn.
"This is all likely a waste of time." I attempt to bop Frank on the head with my quarterstaff.
(( 5 to hit . ))

It misses.

"Oh, are you so sure?" Frank grapples Asturian, holding a knife to his head. "I think this is plenty meaningful."

"Burr! Save me! Protect your emperor! Protect me this instant!" Asturian squirms in terror.

Theo tries to help, but Frank just uses a reaction to send Theo flying down the stairs with his redirected momentum. 

Asturian fails to break free. "If you hurt me you will feel the might of thousands coming to avenge me, do you hear me!? This is a mistake!"

"Shut up, man! You’re boring me…" Frank.

It’s Aeolian’s turn.

I sigh. There's really no point in continuing a physical angle with my attributes. I attempt social engineering instead. This is also unlikely to work -- Frank's motives and mind are incomprehensible to me -- but I can at least say I did all I could.

"Please, everyone. All of this is nothing but jumping to hasty conclusions about the truth. We can discuss this reasonably." I flick my wrist to the side, casting Charm Person on Linjamin. ((13 Wisdom save with advantage))
Frank is unaffected.
Well, alright. I fumble for my dagger. I think that's it for now.

Frank smashes Asturian’s head into the butt of his own knife, dealing 3 damage. Asturian writhes on the floor clutching his face in pain.

"I hope you’ve all learnt a lesson, hmm?" Frank.
"Not really." I shrug.

"Oh, really? Well, I guess I’ll have to kill you too then!"

It’s Asturian’s turn.
"I don't think that follows. I probably already know whatever you wanted me to learn, anyway." I wait for it to be my turn instead of Asturian's.
Wait I meant Aeolian’s turn yeah.
I disengage and begin to flee in the direction of where Theodoric fell.

((End initiative. 50xp)) 

Theo is bleeding slightly from his forehead, but seems otherwise fine. "Did you… Did you get him?"
"Not in any sense." I help him up if needed, and if still being actively pursued, continue to run.

Frank doesn’t seem to have followed.

"Sorry I wasn’t of any help, Lord Burr…"

“It is fine.” I shake my head, slightly disappointed I didn’t get to try out an ingenious trick I had devised for escaping pursuit. “This attack was obviously the Prince’s fault, one way or another. …Still, bolstering the security here so he can’t just do *that* would be ideal…”
Asturian emerges from the office, still looking hurt. "…He’s gone. I scared him off… Hehe…"
“Bravo, Asturian.” I nod. “Your help is appreciated.”
"Regardless, umm… It may be prudent… Not to bother him anymore… At this time." Asturian looks back at the dead soldier.

“Not so brashly, at least. I understand your… grief, at such a bold attack, and an eagerness to resolve the quandary of justice. But you do not have the local familiarity to understand the stakes here. The shadows must be fought with shadows.”
"Hmph… Very well, then. But with your words I expect you to pluck out whoever is at fault from the shadows… And bring them to me."
“Mmhm.”
He scurries out of the building in a panic.
“…I’m still not sure. His status as the culprit feels too… obvious.”
"Who?" Theo.
“Asturian.” I gesture to his absence.
"Why would he ask you to find the killer if it’s him? Is he stupid, Lord Burr?"

“Yes, perhaps. But he specifically wants a killer in the criminal underworld. Perhaps he’d like the manner to be resolved and an answer forced into public consensus as quickly as possible to avoid suspicion being placed on himself. …Though this would be his aim whether or not it was actually him.”
"Ohhh…"

“At any rate, I’m also uncertain what to make of Linjamin’s unusual presence. …I wonder if this was a charade orchestrated by them both? To obfuscate the idea that Asturian himself hired them as assassins. Then again, deceiving me specifically seems like overkill.” I pace around, thinking. “If Asturian truly wants us to find and bring the killer to justice, well, who am I to refuse? And all that depends on gathering information.”
"Umm… Haven’t you heard the rumours that Linjamin is always listening for people who don’t take him seriously?"
“I have heard all rumors, and I do take him rather seriously. He just killed a man in front of me, I believe.”
"Oh, sorry for underestimating you sir!"
“It is fine.”
"What’s the plan now, sir?"

“…That’s one of the primary people to speak to out of the way. I doubt he’ll be feeling any more cooperative any time soon. I’ll check who’s around the area that may know something, and beyond that, we may owe the Duchess a visit.”
"Alright!" He nods.
I exit my home.
Theo follows.
I observe whoever is out and about while making my way to where Maxwell lives.
The major is around. No one else noteworthy sticks out on the way.
I wave to the Major, but do not initiate conversation if he does not.
He smirks condescendingly and stays silent.
I continue to Mr. Skylar’s, then.
Lydia answers the door. "Morning, Alia…"

“Ah. Morning.” Right, yes. She would also live here. Indeed. A fact I’m aware of. I suppose last night’s events were too momentous and taxing, and the present moment too early in the day, for it to be reasonable to expect her to be anywhere but still at home right now. To go back to the club, or whatever she may spend spare time on.
"What did you want?"
“I wished to speak to your father… ah, though, you were just as there. Just as much there.” I clear my throat.
"I didn’t stab him, if that’s what you mean. But you wouldn’t accuse poor old me of that, now would you Alia?"
“Obviously not, no. I have no intention to run in here and throw baseless accusations. The list of suspects is rather narrow, all things considered.”
"Oh, is it now? Well aren’t you a smart boy." She laughs.
This statement makes me exceedingly uncomfortable and I don’t like it. “Okay,” I say, “Well, is he here, though.”
"No, he’d be at the guild headquarters at this time."
“Oh. Sorry.” Damn. I really should keep track of everyone’s schedules better.
"It’s fine. Why wouldn’t I want a visit from the baron?"

“I do not know.” Her mind is an enigma - more vexing than any revolutionary material I develop could ever be. After a slightly-too-long pause, I speak once more. “You were at the ballroom, yes? Did you witness anything notable between then and the attack on the Emperor? I-If not, I understand. I’m just, here anyway. So I’d ask.”
"No, I did not, mr. guard, sir."
“That is not my name.” This situation is bad. I should try to resolve things so we can move on. Maybe. Unless she knows more than she’s letting on. Not that I suspect her, per se.
She giggles. "I know. But congratulations on the promotion to the acting emperor’s lapdog."
“Tha— To the what.” I blink rapidly.
"You hadn’t heard?"
“No.” I shake my head. “Well, I mean maybe. I mean I— I don’t know what you think you’ve heard. Or have heard.”
"Prince Asturian is the acting emperor, until Emperor Aragon wakes up of course… Assuming he ever does."
“Yes. Indeed. I had learned such a notion. That isn’t me.” I gesture to myself. “I am not — him.”
"Yes. But you’re doing his dirty work."
“I would not consider it dirty. And… I would be doing this regardless.”
"Oh?"
“YYesss. I need to be diligent about that which may concern this territory.”
"You think this will affect this place?"
“In the sense it will affect everywhere, but potentially even more so if a conspiracy was birthed within our borders.”
"So you have a suspect in mind, then?"
I purse my lips together in quiet contemplation before speaking again. “It is possible local criminal elements were involved.”
"The hellhounds, then? Or the Craigs..."
I nod.
"It was a question, Alia."
“The answer was yes. Probably more likely the former, given I know they more frequently operate around here and deal in this sort of trade.”
“…I really shouldn’t be talking about… this. This early. Probably.”
She laughs. "Well, then... I guess I'll see you later in your investigation then?'
“Yes. I guess so. Have a nice day, Lydia.”

She smiles and shuts the door.

((End session))
Selle wakes up face down on Laura’s couch. There are 2 large shoes using his back as a footrest.

"Uuurghh..." 
*Why is there something on my back...*
Selle turns their head from the darkness of the couch to see Laura.
"I swear you would find more comfort using anything else as a footrest." Selle yawns, but doesn't move yet.

"Oh, you awake already?" Donald, the source of the shoes, smirks with mock surprise.

Laura looks up from her desk in the corner. "Mm?"

"Donald. Let me get up." 
Selle, or "Yule" as they are known towards Donald and Laura personally, swats their hand to get Donald's feet out of the way, without looking directly at him. 
*No wonder my sleep felt so uncomfortable. Ugh.* 
Selle feels a headache come on.
Donald moves his feet. "Bad night, huh? Where were you? I was sure I’d see at that fancy little gala."

Selle gets up, clutching at their head. This time, they are completely undisguised, with their long white hair and bright hazel eyes unobscured by magic disguises, makeup or contact lenses. They look completely different from when they were at the party.
"I have several reasons for having had a bad night. What I've heard happened at the 'fancy little gala' is one of them. Ugh." 
*This sucks. The emperor's death usually would be good, considering the instability it would bring but with Asturian being technically next in line this could go south very fast.*
"As to where I was, you already know I don't disclose those kinds of things. I'm more interested in what you and Laura saw there."
"Hmph, nothing too important." He leans back. "I got out before the guards could get into pestering me. But anyhow, I’ve got a job for ya!" He shrugs.

*I guess I'll have to wait to get any real information regarding the Emperor's death. But a job, huh? I guess you can never rest.*
Selle sits up.
"Go on, then."

"Well, that whole deal with the emperor last night wasn’t the only major problem happening in this city. Someone slaughtered an entire bar of people on my turf. Usually I’d leave shit like this to the government but they can’t focus on this while the emperor’s would-be-killer hasn’t been caught and I can’t afford to slack off on protection, y’know? That’s where you come in."

*Shouldn't be that bad.*
"Yeah, I get it. Any more details you have?"
(( I'm gonna go put the laundry so give me a minute
"Eh, not really. Can’t afford to let anyone tamper with the place, y’know? I know some of the victims are Locruz's guys, so he might get all pissy. I’ll just take you to it whenever you’re ready."

*Locruz... quite a bit younger than me, should be fine working with him. Gang warfare is a mess. A creation of shit working conditions under our hierarchal system where people have to resort to crime to survive. I sympathise with them.* 
"Alright then. Give me a few minutes, I'll get ready."
Donald steps toward the door. "I’ll wait outside for you to wrap things up with that girlfriend of yours."

"Yeah, yeah, whatever, I'll be there soon."
Selle sighs and looks for a mirror and their things.

They look down at their arm and grab it to suppress the pain. The ashy fully black colour of their skin, almost rotting, stands out in comparison to their more paler skin colour in other areas.
*I need to take my medicine. I'm used to the pain by now but it's not good to wait long after waking up before taking the medicine.*
"You good, Yule?" Laura looks over at them.

"I just need to get ready. Don't worry." 
Selle looks quite dishevelled, having just woken up from a bad rest with their hair uncombed and dishevelled, and all their clothes creased. The only thing that implies any sense of sharpness is the way their eyes look, always bright in colour.
"How was the party for you?" Selle says this while going through their things for medicine, a hairbrush, a hairtie, and gloves.
"Eh, was pretty cool. I got to freak some normies out with my sick dance moves." She recreates the worst dance move Yule has seen in their life.

*Well, sounds like someone had a good night, at least. Pretty heavy juxtaposition there.*
"Oh yeah? Sounds like you had a pretty fun time. Could you pass me some water? Need to stop "freaking" myself out with my own mortality. Wish I didn't have to take this medicine everyday." 
Selle looks in the mirror and ties the back of their hair into a ponytail, and afterwards takes a pill out of the bottle.
Laura tosses him what looks like a bag of water made out of leather. There’s a reusable knot keeping it closed at the top.

"Thanks." 
Selle takes the pill, chasing it with the water. 
*Thank god I don't have to take these dry. It should take only 5 minutes to work.*
"Say, you in the know about anything regarding the Emperor? Some... circumstances forced me to leave before anyone else. I appreciate you getting me in there though. It ended up being... useful."
"Yeah, I think he’s alive? Not awake any time soon though so he’ll get a temporary replacement."

"Huh... comatose, I guess. A temporary replacement for an emperor is a ripe environment for something bad to happen."
Selle is now fully dressed, medicated and ready.
*Comatose. But I think that if it's true his death was planned out then they are definitely going to try and finish him.*
"Anyways, I'll talk to you again next time. You stay safe, although I'm sure you don't need to hear that from me. I appreciate giving me a place to stay after all that happened."

"Yeah, yeah… No worries. Don’t count on it though, that couch’s for my future lover! You’re gonna steal my heart if you keep stealing my house." Selle knows Laura enough to know that they are just being messed with.

"I don't think you should make your future lover sleep on the couch." 
Selle says this, chuckles and heads towards the door to meet with Donald.

Selle is now in a normal looking part of the catacombs under Soltaria. Donald is waiting for him at the door and pats them on the back in greeting. "Alright, my friend! Let’s get back to the topside."

*Always so touchy... At least he's not a creep.*
"Alright, alright. I'll lead the way." Selle and Donald walk a route towards the topside that tries to avoid as many monsters as possible.

Donald leads him to a bar being guarded by 4 members of the Jameson family. "Boss, who’s this?"

“Eh, a temp. You can count on ‘em to catch the people behind this. Let 'em in." Donald.

The gangsters move away from the front door.

*Sketchy as usual. Not that I'm new to this kind of thing.*
Selle bows lightly to the gangsters and makes their way in.

The place is a bloodbath. There are bodies scattered around, many of them in various pieces. The bar is made up of 1 main room, a bathroom, and a back room.  Selle is in the main room, where most victims seem to be. The right side of the room seems to be designed for various games and tables, while the left contains the actual bar counter.

*Ugh. This brings back bad memories. You can never quite get used to it.*
"They really didn't pull any punches. The smell is horrific in here. Let's take a look at the right side of the main room first"
Selle walks towards the right side, towards the game area. They check the number of individual bodies and their locations, as well as the surrounding area in more detail.
((Roll investigation))
There are 6 or 7 people here, most of which seem to be members of Destiny. They have their little insignia still on them, and are clutching various weapons in their hands.
*7 people just in one side of the room. This really was a massacre.* Selle checks the ground for footprints and their direction.
((Roll perception))

There is a set of footprints starting near a man's body that leads into the backroom. As Selle notices this, they also feel a drop of blood fall on their hat. It seems like another body has been sent through the roof. Any other partial footprints seem like they come from the shoes of a nearby victim.
(( just to confirm this place isn't multiple floors right
((It is not))

"...Thank god I'm wearing a hat. To me this brings up the possibility that some sort of magic was involved. There's an insane amount of force needed for something like that to happen with just someone's physical strength." 
*That backroom needs investigation. I'll head there once I've done a general survey of the area.*
Selle heads towards the bar-side of the main room and does another detailed check. They wipe the blood off of their hat first, of course.
((Roll investigation))

There are 3 people dead on this side. The bartender has been smashed through the counter, leaving wooden pieces of the counter to pierce through his body. The other 2 victims just seem to be normal people. Their drinks have been left untouched, but it doesn’t seem like any glasses were where the bartender would’ve been facing when he died. Several bottles of alcohol have been drank and left laying around on the floor near the bodies. Selle can tell these were placed after the killings, since one of the bottles is partially over a dead person’s foot.

"Huh? Something is off here. This bottle looks like it's been intentionally placed here, so someone's gone and touched up the crime scene after it happened... Almost seems like they committed the crime and drank the remains of their drinks? Maybe I shouldn't come to a conclusion on the type of people the killers are yet. I'm not entirely sure if the targets of the murders were supposed to be Destiny, or if it was them and the rest were killed to leave no witnesses. Either way this is extremely brutal, I'm really surprised there wasn't any witness information given to me before I came in here, considering how... loud? It seems it would have been."
Selle inspects the bartenders body for where it was hit.
((Roll medicine))
He seem to have been hit with a blunt force object far larger than a human fist but without a single sharp element. This actually seems consistent with all other bodies.

"What the hell? It seems like everyone just got completely pummelled. What reason would they have to cut others bodies into pieces then? I'll collect all that info later... It seems like there's 10 bodies in total in this main room. All of them died due to blunt force trauma. There's also one body inside the roof itself that's been sent there with a huge impact."
*Ugh... What the hell kind of reason would someone have to pummel someone so hard upwards that it sends them into the roof of a building.*
Selle carefully tries to walk around the blood to enter the back room.
The footsteps lead towards a shelf that has collapsed into the floor. ((Roll perception))
Selle notices a barrel in the room and concludes it must somehow be the murder weapon because it’s somewhere around the same size.
"This barrel is pretty big. I think it could have been the murder weapon. Let me inspect it for any marks."
The front door loudly swing open. "Hey! Come out, you bastard!" It’s Locruz.

*Oh boy.*
Selle comes out of the backroom and squints their eyes at Locruz. *It's just that hotheaded kid.*
"Locruz Klezmer?"
"You! Did you do this!?" He waves his fists threateningly.

"No! Do you think the killer would just stay at the crime scene like this dancing about hours after it happened?" 
Selle sighs.
((Roll persuasion))
"Ugh… Fine! But did you find who did!?"

"I'm in the process of that. Seems like a brutal guy. Bashed everyone's skulls in then cut them to pieces and drank their alcohol. You tell me if someone you know sounds like someone to do that kind of thing"
*I feel bad for him... He's just a kid seeing all this. Nasty stuff.*
"No way, man! That’s fuckin’ crazy!" He notices the shelf. "Hey uh… Do you see that?"
Selle looks at the shelf.

The shelf that is collapsed into floor looks normal until Locruz points him to a foot that is sticking out.

Locruz lifts bits and pieces out slowly.
"What... the hell?" Selle looks surprised and then starts helping Locruz take the rubble out.
This foreign man is unconscious underneath the rubble. He is visibly still breathing.
"Holy shit... This guy is still alive! Get him out, get him out of there!" Selle gestures Locruz to help drag him out of the rubble.

Locruz drags him out. "Who the hell is this guy!?"

"Gghh… Huh?" The foreign man starts to wake up.
"Are you awake? Do you know who you are?" Selle talks to the man in a frantic voice.
((Roll insight))
"I’m… Alive." He sounds disappointed, but not too surprised at this discovery. "And I… Remember some things. I remember my name."
"What's your name?" Selle asks and tries to sit the man upright against the wall, away from where any blood is.
*He seems like he was just on the edge of dying. What the fuck happened in here?*

"Erik… Erik Mussa." He looks around. "Is that… Is that monster gone?"

"It was a monster?" Locruz.

"I… Think so." Erik.
"A monster? I guess we never ruled that kind of thing out. We need to get you first aid, quickly." Selle inspects Erik's body for where injuries are.
"It looked like a human in some ways… But it was massive. Hands like boulders that would tear through bodies. I tried to hide in here." Erik.
"Locruz. Did anyone you know see something like that around?"

"Not that I’ve heard…" Locruz.

Erik stands up with some difficulty. "Are you 2 on the case?"

"I am... and I guess you are too now, right?" Selle looks at Locruz while saying this.
"I should give my name. You can call me Yule, I've been paid to come investigate here since the government is too busy dealing with what happened with the Emperor."
*This guys really been roughed up a lot. I'll give my "business" name away considering I'm here on hired business.*
He takes out a sword. "Please let me help. 3 fighters are gonna do a better job here than 2."
Selle looks Erik up and down and tries to discern his mood and intentions.
((Roll Insight))
Selle can’t get a good read on him.

Selle shrugs. 
"If you can help us look around better, then go ahead. If you really say it was a monster, then we need to figure out how it got here, and, if it was placed here on purpose. Not only that, but it seems like someone tampered with the crime scene before we even got here." 
Selle points at the bodies with the bottles around, near the bar.
"Before that. Are you sure you don't need any first aid? You were crushed under rubble for what seems like almost half a full day."

"I’ll be fine. I activated my second wind." Erik has indeed used that D&D move.

Donald Jameson enters the scene with a cloth around his face to avoid the smell. "Heyyyy! Looks like you found a witness already!"

*Always the most uncouth entrances.*
"Seems like he's been crushed under the rubble here for quite some time. I'm not sure if his memory is fully in tact either. He says he saw a monster. Does that corroborate with any info you have?"

"Maybe. I asked my guys who found this scene. Sounds like your immediate first responder was a guy by the name of Major Iono Wilkinson. Lives in the Burr barony. Aside from that, that fixer of ours sent me a message for ya." Donald. 

"The ex-major? I know that guy." Locruz.
"The Burr barony? Aeolian Burr? and what's the message?"

"Yeah, that guy." Donald sighs. "So uh... The acting Emperor got announced publicly. Imperial Prince Asturian's officially in charge of Soltaria until Emperor Aragon's awake... If that guy ever lets him wake up. I mean obviously Asturian killed him because of this, so I think you oughta settle down and accept we may be living in the empire where magic's a crime sometime soon. That's basically the gist of it." He shrugs. "Don't worry, though... Just means you'll get to charge more for your services in the longrun."

((End session))
Nash wakes up in his bed.
Nash exhales, rubbing his eyes. He slowly climbs out of bed, his limbs sluggish as he moves. The events of yesterday still feel tremendously far away, as if they were only a distant dream.
It's still impossible for him to wrap his mind around, in all honesty. That the Emperor was alive, and breathing, and talking to him - and then he wasn't.
Nash gets dressed and walks out of his room, intent on finding someone.
The Duchess greets him. "Good morning, Nash."
"...Good morning, mother." Nash says, snapping into a bow.
"Have you slept well?"
He rubs his eyes again. "...As well as to be expected."
"How are you, mother?"
She smiles politely. "Just fine, dear. There’s nothing to be worried about. I hear Mr Hamill was with you during the incident, so you have nothing to worry about."
"Yes." He says, somewhat hollowly. "I.. yes, that's true." He straightens up, putting on a smile. "Will we be questioned again today, do you think?"
"Unlikely. I hear he’s managed to pull through, so the case shall hopefully be resolved quickly." ((Roll insight))
((Nvm then))

Nash's mouth twitches. For some reason, that information sends a flood of relief rushing through him. He's not personally invested in the life of the Emperor, of course! But it's still good to know, for a fact, that the regime cannot be toppled like this. Yeah.
"Well, that's a relief." He smiles, bulwarked. "What's the plan for today, then?"
"Business as usual. You have army work, don’t you? They’ll surely have more detailed news."
He nods. "Right. I'll see to it."

A pause. He doesn't... really know how to ask her the question he feels bubbling up in him, pushed unwillingly to the surface. He can sort of.. if he looks, if he squints, he can imagine all the threads coming together, a monstrous conflagration of something, but.. it's no use. He fails to bring it into full view. The strings fall apart. He does not ask her anything, nor does he accuse her of conspiracy. He remains silent.
A sharp nod. "I'll see you later, mother."
"You as well, Nash. Have a nice day."

He eats briefly and without a fuss, after which he sets off. He's not sure *where* Wayne is hanging around, exactly, but most mornings start with him reporting directly to the barracks, so she might be there.
Orion is there. "Good morning, Nash!"
Nash smiles. "Good morning, Orion. I trust you've heard the news from yesterday? A terrible shame."
"Yeah… It’s a tragedy."
"I *am* glad to hear the Emperor will pull through, of course." He says offhandedly. "Even if some might see this as an.. appropriate political shift." He grins.
"Oh, he will?"
"My mother said so." The unspoken *she's always right* is obvious.
"That’s good, then… I don’t think his brother would’ve been fit to rule."
"Certainly not." Nash scoffs. "*Honestly.* It seems so obvious that he's the one who did it."
"I'll pretend I didn't hear that." Ruth punches Nash in the shoulder as she enters. It's not strong enough to hurt, but it is annoying.
Nash yelps and rubs his arm. "Aha... my apologies, Wayne."

"I just received the news. Imperial Prince Asturian will be acting as a temporary emperor until Emperor Aragon wakes up. If he doesn’t, consider his role permanent." She crosses her arms. "As a result, don’t go insulting him like that in a hearable space.”

"He’s… what!? But he hasn’t even been here in decades!" Orion.
Nash crosses his arms. “Well, that is a pain.” He takes a moment to recalibrate. “I’m sure Asturian will be perfectly competent at his job.”

"Were you hoping for the Duchess? She doesn’t hold the same kind of birthright." Ruth says this in a tone that clearly indicates she thinks anyone who didn’t make the same assumption as her is a moron.

“Well-!” Nash says defensively, shoulders hiked up to his ears. “I know she doesn’t possess primogeniture, obviously, but she’s *clearly* more suited to the job. No one cares about this country more than her.”

"Yeah. Our Acting Emperor’s been living in enemy nations, working closely with the AMO. Don’t you think it’s kind of bad to let our empire be governed by someone with clear business interests above our people?” Orion.

"It’s obviously not about what I think, idiots. It’s about what happens in real life. I’m sure just as many people are happy Acting Emperor Asturian is in power as those against it. Their voices don’t do anything but cause public disorder, disorder we have to stamp out to keep this city civil. So don’t go causing a ruckus, recruits." Ruth.
“Me? Cause a ruckus? I would *never.*” Nash says faux-solemnly, then starts giggling.

"The general has called to see us 3 in the castle whenever you 2 are done fucking around." Ruth.

"Understood, captain!" Orion.
"Right!" Nash says, snapping into a semi-ironic salute. He sends Orion a teasing look from the corner of his eye, a very *get-a-load-of-this-guy* beat.
"Alright, let’s go." Ruth heads towards the castle. Orion follows.
Nash follows as well.

They enter the office of Jonald Triden. He gives them a quick curious look before nodding to himself.

"We’re here as you asked, sir." Ruth.
Nash stands behind Ruth and attempts to look properly respectful.

Orion does the same.

"Yes, yes… You all heard? We got a pr- Emper- Pretendoror…" Triden nods. "We got bad, friends." He points to the spot in his chest where Aragon was stabbed.
"Er... yes."

"Need to catch that axe wielding psychopath. Bad dude." Triden gets up from his desk. "You’re all on the job. Don’t play games… don’t win prizes. Giving you lot free reign to chase down- Down those- Chasers."
"Yessir!"

"Full jurisdict- The works. Do it all. Can’t trust that garbage man. Swing hammer- The of law. You hear me, kid?" Triden.

"Yes sir!" Ruth.

"Til our emperor’s dead I’m still allowed to serve this country no matter what that shiteater's gonna say. He can take his complaints to me. I’m gonna… Gonna-" He says absolute gibberish.
Nash nods along seriously and pretends to understand what he's saying.

"Are you… Saying you want us to pursue the killer at our free discretion?" Ruth.

"Y-Yes, do you got corn in your ears? Am I speaking Ardelunian to you? Get that- Libra, man… Get to it." Triden.

"Understood… Sir." Ruth.
"Thank you, Sir.."

Ruth rushes them out of the room. "Has he always been that incoherent?"

“I mean, I’d heard the rumours but…" Orion.
Nash grimaces. "He wasn't that great at the party yesterday, either."

"Huh. It’s a wonder he still has his position, then…" Ruth.

"Well… I’m not the expert, but… Apparently the emperor has *tried* to fire him before… He’s just very… Stubborn? Though it seems more like he wouldn’t even understand if he was told." Orion.

"Don’t be so dramatic. He seemed at least somewhat aware of what was happening around him. And now we’ve got free reign to do an important job that would normally get overseen by the acting emperor." Ruth.
Nash grins, adjusting his collar. "Personally, I think we should view this as a perfect opportunity to move up in the ranks!"

"Oh, good point! They’ll owe us!" Orion.

Ruth punches the 2 of them in the face, dealing 1 damage to both. "Focus, you greedy kids. We need to figure out where to start."
"Wah! Fine, fine..." Nash grouches, rubbing his face.
Ruth installs them in a small room with a table. "Alright, let’s start with a list of suspects to look into."
Nash sits, placing his head in his cupped palms. "What've you got, boss?"
"Well, the question is who had the most reason to want the emperor dead. There’s no wrong answer at this stage." Ruth writes down the names of other Athelian nations on a sheet of paper.
Nash winces. "Buuuut, we're not allowed to bring up Asturian, right?"

Ruth writes Asturian down. "That seems like what General Triden wanted from us."

"Well, while we’re throwing out the more dangerous guesses… What about Triden? He’s barely coherent and seems to hate being told what to do by the acting emperor. Isn’t it worth considering he might do something in a fit of rage and forget?" Orion.
Nash nods, albeit while chewing on his bottom lip. "I suppose it's possible, but I don't want to believe the general would do something like that."
"Triden has always supported Aragon publicly. I suppose he *could* be lying, but that seems like a very long con..."

"Who knows if he can even remember who Aragon even is anymore?" Orion.

"I’ll write it down, but let’s not jump to assumptions." Ruth writes down Triden’s name, followed by the Duchess.
"H-hold on." Nash says, smile growing immediately forced. "I know we're *throwing out dangerous guesses,* and all, but we don't need to go out of our way to consider the utterly ridiculous..!"

"Why not? You yourself considered the possibility she’d get to become empress." Ruth.

"Well, it’s… Personal knowledge, y’know? Nash would’ve noticed something." Orion.
Nash nods frantically. "I would have. And she still...  I mean, she understands the role law has in all things."
"She wouldn't turn to such underhanded methods."

"Fine." Ruth crosses it out.

"What about the hellhounds?" Orion.

"They wouldn’t be able to sneak into the castle." Ruth.
"It would most likely have to be someone who was already invited to the party." Nash says.

"We can try looking for the guest list, then." Ruth nods. "Let’s split up for now to maximize how much ground we cover in the castle. I’ll track down the guest list. Orion, you look for witnesses. Nash, check the crime scene itself for any evidence."
"Alright, ma'am!" Nash says, saluting neatly.

"I wasn’t looking for confirmation. Go. Get to work." Ruth shoves them towards the door.

Orion rushes off to look for people.
Nash rolls his eyes, and sets off the leave. Presumably towards the ballroom, which was where Aragon collapsed.
It was in a hallway actually, but regardless. The bloodstain and sword have been conveniently left there for the investigation.
Nash attempts to first investigate the bloodstain.
It is indeed a bloodstain. It’s dried now. ((Roll medicine))
Nash discovers nothing more.
How frustrating.
Nash moves to the sword, and attempts to investigate that as well.

Nash doesn’t notice anything interesting about the sword.

"Looking for something?" Washington calls out to him.
Nash turns around. "Oh, hello. I'm just investigating, 's all."
"Is that the sword that did it?"
"I'd assume so!"
"Probably not any kind of recognizable feature, then. The owner wouldn’t want to get caught."
Nash frowns. "Yes, it seems likely. I wonder.." He trails off, unsure of how to put his thoughts into words. "Well, anyways. What're you doing here, Washington?"
"Work. I came to talk to the acting emperor on behalf of the duchess." The duchess would normally come here herself for the emperor.
Nash raises an eyebrow. "Is there a reason why she couldn't see to it herself?"
"It’s Asturian." He states simply.
He frowns, corners of his mouth turning down. "Yes, I suppose that makes sense.. may I accompany you?"
"…Why?"
"Why do you think?" He tries to put on a smirk. "Don't you think it's a good idea for me to try and endear myself to the acting emperor?"
“Ugh, fine. Come on." He heads towards the throne room.
*Yessss.* Nash internally celebrates, and follows.

Asturian is not here.

"Where’s the acting emperor?" Washington.

"He’s just returned from a rather difficult situation at Baron Burr's estate. Please give him a moment." Servant.
Nash lets out an exaggerated sigh and slumps against the wall.

"A difficult situation?" Washington.

"He was attacked by the leader of the Faceless."
Nash raises an eyebrow. "Is he alright?"
